1.6 Planned Changes to Improve Safety

Rio Grande Juice Company has implemented many policies and procedures to promote overall plant, worker and public safety. Nevertheless, Rio Grande Juice Company continually strives to improve in all areas, including safety.

By utilizing PSMWriter software, all necessary employees have access to every aspect of the RMP-PSM program. This has improved Rio Grande Juice Company’s ability to communicate hazardous situations to employees and contractors. In addition, PSMWriter tracks all RMP-PSM related events so that Rio Grande Juice Company’s management team can ensure that the RMP-PSM program is being implemented.

Rio Grande Juice Company has implemented all aspects of the RMP-PSM program. When a RMP-PSM program requirement is completed (i.e. mechanical integrity inspection, process hazard analysis, compliance audit, etc.) any specific action items related to that event are entered into PSMWriter, assigned a responsible person, and given a due date. 1.3 General Accident Release & Chemical Specific Prevention Steps

1.3.1 General 

We inform our employees engaged in process operations of the dangers of an accidental release of anhydrous ammonia in annual safety meetings. During these meeting we also discuss preventative measures, such as evacuation, in order to be prepared for a release.

Rio Grande Juice Company has also conducted an off-site consequence analysis of worst-case and alternative release scenarios for the ammonia refrigeration process. These are for the purposes of informing the public in the event of an accidental release. The results of the analyses are reported in PSMWriter and hardcopy binders. 

1.3.2 Anhydrous Ammonia

The ammonia refrigeration process at the Rio Grande Juice Company facility is an integral part of the overall business and operates most of the year. It is extremely important that this process is maintained and operated in a safe and efficient manner. Management is committed to making sure that employees are made aware of the potential danger of an ammonia leak.

Our refrigeration personnel monitor the ammonia refrigeration process and keep an active logbook of all procedures and transactions that pertain to ammonia. In addition, the process is checked frequently by one of the outside refrigeration contractors that we use. These contractors also assist in performing the annual mechanical integrity inspection of our ammonia equipment. 

1.4 Five Year Accident History

Rio Grande Juice Company has had no accidental release within the last five (5) years.

1.2.2 Facility Location

Rio Grande Juice is located at 702 E. Expressway 83 Mission, TX 78572. The latitude and longitude of the facility is 26.197993, -98.322909. The facility is located approximately 880 feet south of Interstate 2 in an industrial area.

According to FEMA Flood Map Service, the facility is located in an area where no digital data is available. 

A review of United States Geological Survey (USGS) fault maps revealed that there are no faults in close proximity to the site. The USGS 2018 One-Year Model revealed that Rio Grande Juice has less than a  1% chance of experiencing “potentially minor-damage” due to ground shaking in 2018.

This program is intended to meet the spirit and intent of the following regulations:
- Federal EPA Risk Management Program (RMP) – Title 40 CFR §68
- Federal Process Safety Management (PSM) Program, Title 29 CFR §1910.119

Hereafter this program will be referred to as the RMP-PSM program.

This program is intended to be a “living document”. As such, the information, procedures, policies, and documentation that make up this program must be made easily accessible and updated as necessary. To accomplish this, Rio Grande Juice Company has elected to use PSMWriter, software developed and distributed by Resource Compliance, Inc. This software will assist us with updating, maintaining, scheduling, and tracking RMP-PSM related activities. 

1.1 Rio Grande Juice Company, Risk and Process Safety Management Program

This is to inform all interested persons, including employees, that Rio Grande Juice Company has developed their unified RMP-PSM Program. This program has been prepared to address the risks involved in operating and maintaining the following process which have the presence of hazardous chemicals above threshold quantities: 

P1 Main System
Anhydrous Ammonia

Our RMP-PSM program promotes overall plant, worker, and public safety. The program enables our facility to prevent the occurrence, and minimize the consequences, of significant releases of hazardous chemicals. Overall, the program is designed to prevent accidental fatalities, injuries, illnesses, and physical property damage.

Our company has many policies and procedures in place to promote overall plant, worker and public safety. We have: 
1. Prepared a unified program based on the PSM regulation to meet RMP obligations as well
2. Organized the program so that it meshes closely with general business practices
3. Utilized PSMWriter software to ensure that all necessary employees have access to relevant information (SOPs, PHAs, audits, etc.)
